revised_title: Effects of High Temperature on the Human Body
tldr: The author describes experiments conducted by Dr. George Fordyce to observe the effects of high temperatures on the human body. The experiments involved heating a room to extreme temperatures and observing the effects on the participants' body temperature, pulse, respiration, and circulation. The results showed that the human body has a remarkable ability to resist and regulate heat, and that the transition from extreme heat to cold is not as detrimental as previously thought.
